sub_topic: Using the power rule to differentiate functions
message_1: Calculate the derivative of the function f(x) = 4x^5 using the power rule of differentiation.
message_2:
The power rule of differentiation states that if f(x) = x^n, then f'(x) = n * x^(n-1). 

Applying the power rule to the function f(x) = 4x^5, we have:

f'(x) = 5 * 4x^(5-1)
f'(x) = 20x^4
